title: FPS Drop
body:
I seem to have massive fps drops at random moments. Moving items drops fps to 1-4, and sometimes it drops when i cast random spells like smite or sth. The whole game just freezes for 2sec but until then its smooth 60fps. I have played on windows 8 on this same laptop and it was just fine. It automatically updated to win10 and i think this is when the problems started. 
Anyone else having similar problems?
How to fix it?

replies.body: It's possible that some drivers need to be updated with your OS upgrade, or that the game needs to scan for corrupt game files.  Rineyy's solution to run a repair is a good step, but we also have a an [FPS troubleshoot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide that will provide some other troubleshoot steps first.  Please let me know if your issue persists after running the steps in the guide.

Thank you for your answers. I will try to "repair" the game and if that doesnt work I'll try to reinstall or sth. I found that some people had the same problems. It was always AMD graphics card on a laptop.

Since you updated to Windows 10, it's possible all of League file didn't weren't copied. 

Repair the game by clicking the question mark icon to the top right of the patcher. Select "Repair" and let the patcher scan and repair corrupt game files. When the process is completed, you'll see the orange "Launch" button.

Do this behavior of fps continue in other games? It might be a driver problem in your pc. If you are lucky and havnt removed the windows.old folder then you can restore windows 8 (google it or just ask me if you cant get it to work). I have an old laptop. When it got windows 10 the network card stopped working because of the driver didnt work and windows 10 and no drivers for my network was or will ever be made for windows 10. I rolled it back to windows 7 but after all it is a old laptop so I dont use it and have a gaming msi I use. Warning the windows.old folder will remove itself after some time to save space and many cleaner programs remove it to save space.
